article_node.title: This Hurricane Season I'm Using 7 iPhone Weather Apps to Protect My Family
article_node.summary: The article reviews a range of iPhone weather apps that help residents in hurricane‑prone areas stay informed and prepared. It highlights NOAA‑based tools such as the National Hurricane Center app and the American Red Cross Emergency app, which provide real‑time tracking, alerts, and shelter information, as well as consumer apps like My Hurricane Tracker, My Radar, Rain Viewer, Clime, and Weather Channel’s Storm Radar that offer radar, historical data, and customizable notifications. The piece compares free and paid tiers, noting that many apps bundle satellite imagery, long‑range forecasts, and advanced features behind subscriptions, while still offering useful free versions. Overall, it encourages readers to try a few of these apps to build a reliable digital toolkit for hurricane season.
